name: Ancestor's Chosen

flavor_text: Every tear shed is a drop of immortality.

oracle_text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor_text: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.

name: Angelic Chorus
oracle_text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain life equal to its toughness.
flavor_text: The harmony of the glorious is a dirge to the wicked.

rulings.text: This does not trigger on a permanent being turned into a creature. That is just a permanent changing type, not something entering the battlefield.
Angelic Chorus does not trigger when creatures phase in or change controllers.

name: Angelic Wall
oracle_text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
flavor_text:
"The Ancestor protects us in ways we can't begin to comprehend."
—Mystic elder

name: Aura of Silence
oracle_text: Artifact and enchantment spells your opponents cast cost {2} more to cast.
Sacrifice Aura of Silence: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor_text: Not all silences are easily broken.

rulings.text: Aura of Silence affects all opponents in a multiplayer game.

name: Aven Cloudchaser
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Cloudchaser enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
flavor_text:
"At the Reapportionment, Eagle begged to be human. The Ancestor granted half that prayer."
—Nomad myth

name: Ballista Squad
oracle_text: {X}{W}, {T}: Ballista Squad deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor_text: The perfect antidote for a tightly packed formation.

name: Bandage
oracle_text: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
Draw a card.
flavor_text: Life is measured in inches. To a healer, every one of those inches is precious.

rulings.text: You draw the card when Bandage resolves, not when the damage is actually prevented.

name: Beacon of Immortality
oracle_text: Double target player's life total. Shuffle Beacon of Immortality into its owner's library.
flavor_text: The cave floods with light. A thousand rays shine forth and meld into one.

rulings.text: If you double a negative life total, you do the real math. A life total of -10 becomes -20.
Beacon of Immortality’s effect counts as life gain (or life loss, if the life total was negative) for effects that trigger on or replace life gain (or life loss).
If a Beacon is countered or doesn’t resolve, it’s put into its owner’s graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

name: Benalish Knight
oracle_text: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor_text:
"We called them ‘armored lightning.'"
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Cho-Manno, Revolutionary
oracle_text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Cho-Manno, Revolutionary.
flavor_text: "Mercadia's masks can no longer hide the truth. Our day has come at last."

name: Condemn
oracle_text: Put target attacking creature on the bottom of its owner's library. Its controller gains life equal to its toughness.
flavor_text:
"No doubt the arbiters would put you away, after all the documents are signed. But I will have justice now!"
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

rulings.text: The affected creature’s last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its toughness.

name: Demystify
oracle_text: Destroy target enchantment.
flavor_text:
"Illusion is a crutch for those with no grounding in reality."
—Cho-Manno

name: Field Marshal
oracle_text: Other Soldier creatures get +1/+1 and have first strike. (They deal combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor_text: He is the only one who sees the patterns in the overlapping maps and conflicting reports.

name: Ghost Warden
oracle_text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"I thought of fate as an iron lattice, intricate but rigidly unchangeable. That was until some force bent fate's bars to spare my life."
—Ilromov, traveling storyteller

name: Glorious Anthem
oracle_text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor_text: Once heard, the battle song of an angel becomes part of the listener forever.

name: Hail of Arrows
oracle_text: Hail of Arrows deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target attacking creatures.
flavor_text:
"Do not let a single shaft loose until my word. And when I give that word, do not leave a single shaft in Eiganjo."
—General Takeno

rulings.text: You choose how the damage will be divided among the target creatures at the time you cast Hail of Arrows. Each target must be dealt at least 1 damage. If any of those creatures becomes an illegal target before Hail of Arrows resolves, the division of damage among the remaining creatures doesn’t change.

name: Heart of Light
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
flavor_text: For those who reach enlightenment, violence is an unnecessary distraction.

name: High Ground
oracle_text: Each creature you control can block an additional creature each combat.
flavor_text: In war, as in society, position is everything.

rulings.text: High Ground’s effect is cumulative. If you have a creature that can already block an additional creature, now it can block three creatures.

High Ground allows you to make some complicated blocks. For example, if you’re being attacked by three creatures (call them A, B, and C) and you control three creatures (X, Y, and Z), you can have X block A and B, Y block B and C, and Z block just C, among many other possible options. The defending player chooses how each blocking creature’s combat damage will be divided among the creatures it’s blocking.

name: Holy Day
oracle_text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
flavor_text:
"Today there is feasting and peace across our land, but the war has not ended. Tuck away your bloodlust. You'll need it tomorrow."
—Karrim, Samite healer

name: Holy Strength
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
flavor_text:
"May angels fly at your back. May your blade cleave the darkness."
—War blessing of Serra

name: Honor Guard
oracle_text: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: The strength of one. The courage of ten.

name: Icatian Priest
oracle_text: {1}{W}{W}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Grelden knelt and felt the cool, dry hand of the priest on his brow. Hours later, when his wits returned, he was covered in his enemies' blood on the field of victory.

name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
oracle_text: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.
flavor_text: Upon the frozen tundra stand the Kjeldoran Royal Guard, pikes raised, with the king's oath upon their lips.

rulings.text: If you activate the ability but Kjeldoran Royal Guard leaves the battlefield before combat damage is dealt, the combat damage from unblocked creatures won’t be redirected. It will be dealt to you as normal.

name: Loxodon Mystic
oracle_text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
flavor_text: Elder mystics take their vow of silence so seriously that they impose it on any who enter their presence.

name: Loyal Sentry
oracle_text: When Loyal Sentry blocks a creature, destroy that creature and Loyal Sentry.
flavor_text: "My cause is simple: To stop you, at any cost, from ever seeing the inside of this keep."

rulings.text: Loyal Sentry and the creature it blocks are destroyed before combat damage is dealt. The blocked creature is destroyed even if Loyal Sentry leaves the battlefield before its triggered ability resolves.

name: Luminesce
oracle_text: Prevent all damage that black sources and red sources would deal this turn.
flavor_text:
"The White Shield is not the burnished metal you lash to your forearm but the conviction that burns in your chest."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter,
leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Mobilization
oracle_text: Soldier creatures have vigilance.
{2}{W}: Create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.
flavor_text: Wars are won with strength, valor, and numbers—especially numbers.

name: Nomad Mythmaker
oracle_text: {W}, {T}: Put target Aura card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control attached to a creature you control.
flavor_text: On the wild steppes, history vanishes in the dust. Only the mythmakers remain to say what was, and is, and will be.

rulings.text: You don’t choose which creature the Aura will enter the battlefield attached to until the ability resolves. You must choose a creature the Aura can legally enchant. (For example, you can’t choose a creature with protection from black if the targeted Aura card is black.) If you don’t control any creatures that the Aura can enchant, it remains in the graveyard.
Nomad Mythmaker’s ability can target an Aura card in any graveyard, not just yours.

name: Pacifism
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
flavor_text: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.

name: Paladin en-Vec
oracle_text: First strike, protection from black and from red (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black or red.)
flavor_text: "I do not consider myself a hero. I know only what the Vec teach: justice must always be served and corruption must always be opposed."

name: Pariah
oracle_text: Enchant creature
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.
flavor_text:
"Why would I consider penance for my actions when I have so many subjects willing to do it for me?"
—Lord Konda

rulings.text: You can attach this to an opponent’s creature, and all damage done to you is instead done to their creature.

All damage being dealt to you at one time gets redirected to one Pariah. If you take 3 damage at once, all 3 damage goes to one Pariah. If you take damage from multiple creatures in combat, all the combat damage goes to one Pariah.

name: Reviving Dose
oracle_text: You gain 3 life.
Draw a card.
flavor_text: Samite healers never mix their pungent elixir with sweetener or tea. The threat of a second dose is enough to get most warriors back on their feet.

name: Reya Dawnbringer
oracle_text: Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor_text: "You have not died until I consent."

name: Righteousness
oracle_text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Sometimes the greatest strength is the strength of conviction.

rulings.text: A “blocking creature” is one that has been declared as a blocker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield blocking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocking creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures it was blocking are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat.

name: Rule of Law
oracle_text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
flavor_text: Appointed by the kha himself, members of the tribunal ensure all disputes are settled with the utmost fairness.

name: Samite Healer
oracle_text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor_text: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

name: Serra Angel
oracle_text: Flying, vigilance
flavor_text: Her sword sings more beautifully than any choir.

name: Serra's Embrace
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying and vigilance.
flavor_text: The touch of Serra's angels bears hopes aloft and empowers noble causes.

name: Skyhunter Patrol
oracle_text: Flying, first strike (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and it deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor_text:
"We leonin have come to rule the plains by taking to the skies."
—Raksha Golden Cub

name: Skyhunter Prowler
oracle_text: Flying, vigilance (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
flavor_text: As tireless as her mount, a skyhunter's vigil is measured in days.

name: Skyhunter Skirmisher
oracle_text: Flying, double strike
flavor_text:
"Take the deadly grace and strength of the leonin, combined with a pteron mount capable of rending a foe in two and armed with notched steel. That is a skyhunter—and why Taj-Nar has never fallen."
—Raksha Golden Cub

name: Soul Warden
oracle_text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
flavor_text:
Count carefully the souls and see that none are lost.
—Vec teaching

rulings.text: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering the battlefield, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.
Two Soul Wardens entering the battlefield at the same time will each cause the other’s ability to trigger.
The life gain is mandatory.

name: Spirit Link
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
flavor_text: "We are all inextricably linked, souls woven in tapestry."

rulings.text: You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.

You gain life for all damage which is not prevented, regardless of what the creature damages (player or another creature) or the toughness of the blocking creature. If you put this on a 5/5 and it is blocked by a 1/1, you still gain 5 life.

name: Spirit Weaver
oracle_text: {2}: Target green or blue creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: "Let my hope be your shield."

name: Starlight Invoker
oracle_text: {7}{W}: You gain 5 life.
flavor_text: "The constellations form a tapestry of light that traces my people's broken history. Day and night, I feel their glittering presence calling me to weave the pattern whole."

name: Steadfast Guard
oracle_text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
flavor_text: "Best leave your tongue in its yap-hole, Mercadian scum, for your silvered words and golden bribes do not sparkle so brightly outside your city."

name: Story Circle
oracle_text: As Story Circle enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{W}: The next time a source of your choice of the chosen color would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Suntail Hawk
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text: Its eye the glaring sun, its cry the keening wind.

name: Tempest of Light
oracle_text: Destroy all enchantments.
flavor_text: "Let everything return to its true nature, so that destiny may takes its course."

name: Treasure Hunter
oracle_text: When Treasure Hunter enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

name: True Believer
oracle_text: You have shroud. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor_text: So great is his certainty that mere facts cannot shake it.

name: Tundra Wolves
oracle_text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor_text:
"I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains."
—Onean scout

name: Venerable Monk
oracle_text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
flavor_text: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.

name: Voice of All
oracle_text: Flying
As Voice of All enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Voice of All has protection from the chosen color.

name: Wall of Swords
oracle_text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
flavor_text: The air hummed with the scissoring sound of uncounted blades that hovered in front of the invaders as though wielded by a phalanx of unseen hands.

name: Warrior's Honor
oracle_text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"The day will come when the righteous warrior faces a battle she cannot win. She will greet that day as she has any other."
—Asmira, holy avenger

rulings.text: Warrior’s Honor affects creatures you control that are on the battlefield at the time it resolves. If you put a creature onto the battlefield later in the turn, that creature won’t get the bonus.

name: Wild Griffin
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text:
"I abandoned my dream of a squadron of griffin-riders when the cost proved too high. Three trainers were eaten for every griffin broken to the bridle."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Windborn Muse
oracle_text: Flying
Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature they control that's attacking you.
flavor_text:
"Her voice is justice, clear and relentless."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

rulings.text: If you have more than one of these on the battlefield, the cost is cumulative.
In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.
Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can’t attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

name: Wrath of God
oracle_text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

name: Youthful Knight
oracle_text: First strike
flavor_text: Idealism fits him better than his armor.

name: Academy Researchers
oracle_text: When Academy Researchers enters the battlefield, you may put an Aura card from your hand onto the battlefield attached to Academy Researchers.
flavor_text: They brandish their latest theories as warriors would wield weapons.

rulings.text: You can’t put an Aura card from your hand onto the battlefield this way if that Aura can’t legally enchant Academy Researchers. For example, you can’t put an Aura with “enchant land” or “enchant green creature” onto the battlefield attached to Academy Researchers (unless Academy Researchers somehow turned into a land or a green creature before the ability resolved).

name: Air Elemental
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor_text:
"The East Wind, an interloper in the dominions of Westerly Weather, is an impassive-faced tyrant with a sharp poniard held behind his back for a treacherous stab."
—Joseph Conrad, The Mirror of the Sea

name: Ambassador Laquatus
oracle_text: {3}: Target player puts the top three cards of their library into their graveyard.
flavor_text: "Life is a game. The only thing that matters is whether you're a pawn or a player."

name: Arcanis the Omnipotent
oracle_text: {T}: Draw three cards.
{2}{U}{U}: Return Arcanis the Omnipotent to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: "Do not concern yourself with my origin, my race, or my ancestry. Seek my record in the pits, and then make your wager."

rulings.text: Arcanis’s last ability can only be activated while it’s on the battlefield.

name: Aura Graft
oracle_text: Gain control of target Aura that's attached to a permanent. Attach it to another permanent it can enchant.
flavor_text: "It's not really stealing. It's more like extended borrowing."

rulings.text: If there is no legal place to move the enchantment, then it doesn’t move but you still control it.
Aura Graft’s effect has no duration. You’ll retain control of the Aura until the game ends, the Aura leaves the battlefield, or an effect causes someone else to gain control of the Aura.
You can target an Aura you already control just to move that Aura to a new permanent.

name: Aven Fisher
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Fisher dies, you may draw a card.
flavor_text: The same spears that catch their food today will defend their homes tomorrow.

name: Aven Windreader
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Target player reveals the top card of their library.
flavor_text: "The tiniest ripple tells a story ten fathoms deep."

name: Boomerang
oracle_text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: Early Jamuraan hunters devised a weapon that would return to its source. Tolarian Æthermancers developed a spell that skipped the weapon entirely.

name: Cancel
oracle_text: Counter target spell.

name: Cephalid Constable
oracle_text: Whenever Cephalid Constable deals combat damage to a player, return up to that many target permanents that player controls to their owner's hand.
flavor_text: Cephalids don't police people. They police loyalties.

name: Clone
oracle_text: You may have Clone enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield.

rulings.text: If the chosen creature is copying something else (for example, if the chosen creature is another Clone), then your Clone enters the battlefield as whatever the chosen creature copied.
If the chosen creature is a token, Clone copies the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that put it onto the battlefield. Clone is not a token.

Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied creature will trigger when Clone enters the battlefield. Any “as [this creature] enters the battlefield” or “[this creature] enters the battlefield with” abilities of the chosen creature will also work.
If the chosen creature has {X} in its mana cost (such as Protean Hydra), X is considered to be zero.

Clone copies exactly what was printed on the original creature and nothing more (unless that creature is copying something else or is a token; see below). It doesn’t copy whether that creature is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it or Auras attached to it, or any non-copy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
If Clone somehow enters the battlefield at the same time as another creature, Clone can’t become a copy of that creature. You may choose only a creature that’s already on the battlefield.
You can choose not to copy anything. In that case, Clone enters the battlefield as a 0/0 Shapeshifter creature, and is probably put into the graveyard immediately.
Clone’s ability doesn’t target the chosen creature.

name: Cloud Elemental
oracle_text: Flying
Cloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.
flavor_text: The soratami surround their sky-castles with living clouds that serve as both sword and shield.

name: Cloud Sprite
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Cloud Sprite can block only creatures with flying.
flavor_text: The delicate sprites carry messages for Saprazzans, but they refuse to land in Mercadia City's filthy markets.

name: Counsel of the Soratami
oracle_text: Draw two cards.
flavor_text: "Wisdom is not the counting of all the drops in a waterfall. Wisdom is learning why the water seeks the earth."

name: Crafty Pathmage
oracle_text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.
flavor_text:
Follow the pathmage
—Otarian expression meaning
"escape quickly"

rulings.text: If you increase the power of the targeted creature after the ability resolves, it still can’t be blocked that turn.

name: Dehydration
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
flavor_text: The viashino used the spell to dry foods for crossing the Great Desert. The Suq'Ata later discovered its use in war.

name: Deluge
oracle_text: Tap all creatures without flying.
flavor_text:
"From the sea came all life, and to the sea it will return. The sooner the better."
—Emperor Aboshan

name: Denizen of the Deep
oracle_text: When Denizen of the Deep enters the battlefield, return each other creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: According to merfolk legend, a denizen of the deep swallows the horizon at the end of each day, bringing on the cold blanket of night.

name: Discombobulate
oracle_text: Counter target spell. Look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
flavor_text:
"I said ‘pick his brain,' not ‘tear off his head.'"
—Riptide Project researcher

name: Dreamborn Muse
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts the top X cards of their library into their graveyard, where X is the number of cards in their hand.
flavor_text:
"Her voice is insight, piercing and true."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

name: Evacuation
oracle_text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor_text:
"Once I supply the breeze, you'll see your warriors for the smoke they truly are."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

name: Flashfreeze
oracle_text: Counter target red or green spell.
flavor_text:
"Nature? Fire? Bah! Both are chaotic and difficult to control. Ice is structured, latticed, light as a feather, massive as a glacier. In ice, there is power!"
—Heidar, Rimewind master

name: Fog Elemental
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Fog Elemental attacks or blocks, sacrifice it at end of combat.
flavor_text:
"It's the perfect sentry. Those who should pass can go right through it."
—Teferi

name: Fugitive Wizard
flavor_text:
"The law has its place—as a footnote in my spellbook."
—Siyani, fugitive mage

name: Horseshoe Crab
oracle_text: {U}: Untap Horseshoe Crab.
flavor_text:
"Hmm . . . It looks kinda like a bug. Let's crack it open an' see if it tastes like one!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

name: Hurkyl's Recall
oracle_text: Return all artifacts target player owns to their hand.
flavor_text: Hurkyl's research at the College of Lat-Nam wasn't enough to stop the two brothers, but for centuries thereafter her spellcraft taught artificers restraint.

rulings.text: Retrieves all artifacts owned by the target player regardless of who controls them. Ignores artifacts owned by other players even if target player has control of them.
It only returns artifacts which are on the battlefield.

name: Lumengrid Warden
flavor_text: The wardens keep watch over an endless sea of progress.

name: Mahamoti Djinn
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor_text: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

name: March of the Machines
oracle_text: Each noncreature artifact is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. (Equipment that's a creature can't equip a creature.)

rulings.text: If a noncreature artifact is also another card type, such as enchantment or land, it will retain those types in addition to being an artifact creature.

If an Equipment becomes a creature, it can no longer equip a creature. If it’s currently attached to a creature, it becomes unattached (but remains on the battlefield). You can activate the Equipment’s equip ability, but it won’t do anything.
Each artifact land has a converted mana cost of 0. March of the Machines makes them 0/0 creatures, which are put into the graveyard as a state-based action.

If a noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature this way and then another effect animates it, the new effect overrides March of the Machines’s effect. For example, Chimeric Staff is a 4/4 creature while March of the Machines is on the battlefield. If you activate Chimeric Staff’s ability and choose X = 5, Chimeric Staff will be a 5/5 artifact creature for the rest of the turn.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the “summoning sickness” rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn.

name: Merfolk Looter
oracle_text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor_text:
It belongs to the merfolk now.
—Shipwreck prayer

rulings.text: You can’t do anything in between drawing a card and discarding a card, including casting or cycling the card you drew.

name: Mind Bend
oracle_text: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonblack creature" to "nongreen creature" or "forestwalk" to "islandwalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)
flavor_text:
"The world, I've come to realize, is a blank canvas on which to paint."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

rulings.text: Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can’t change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.
You can’t change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as “Island Fish Jasconius”.
It can be used to change a land’s type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn’t change the name of any permanent.

name: Peek
oracle_text: Look at target player's hand.
Draw a card.

name: Persuasion
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
You control enchanted creature.
flavor_text: There's no telling what an accomplished mage might collect.

name: Phantom Warrior
oracle_text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
flavor_text:
"There are as many pillows of illusion as flakes in a snow-storm. We wake from one dream into another dream."

name: Plagiarize
oracle_text: Until end of turn, if target player would draw a card, instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card.
flavor_text: "Are you thinking what I'm thinking?"

rulings.text: If you target yourself, this spell has no useful effect. It will not cause an infinite loop since a replacement effect can’t modify the same event more than once. This effect will not modify the draw that it has you perform.
You draw the card from your library as normal, not from your opponent’s library.

If you and your opponent each cast Plagiarize on each other during the same turn, the two spells effectively cancel each other out. You will draw cards when you normally would and so will your opponent.

If you target a player whose library is empty, any effect or turn-based action that would cause that player to draw a card will cause you to draw a card instead. It doesn’t matter that the other player would be unable to draw.

name: Puppeteer
oracle_text: {U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
flavor_text:
"That's the funny thing about free will. You don't feel any different without it."
—Ambassador Laquatus

rulings.text: You decide on resolution whether or not to tap or untap the creature.

name: Reminisce
oracle_text: Target player shuffles their graveyard into their library.
flavor_text: Leave the door to the past even slightly ajar and it could be blown off its hinges.

rulings.text: This card won’t be put into your graveyard until after it’s finished resolving, which means it won’t be shuffled into your library as part of its own effect.

name: Remove Soul
oracle_text: Counter target creature spell.
flavor_text: When your enemies are denied soldiers, they are denied victory.

rulings.text: A “creature spell” is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

name: Robe of Mirrors
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor_text:
"Some say you cannot hit what you cannot see. I prefer that you hit what I want you to see."
—Arcanis the Omnipotent

rulings.text: Having shroud will prevent the creature from being targeted by Aura spells, but it does not remove any Auras that are already attached to the creature or stop Auras from being moved to the creature by some other method.

name: Rootwater Commando
oracle_text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor_text: Rootwater merfolk are seldom seen these days, but elf corpses are as numerous as ever.

name: Rootwater Matriarch
oracle_text: {T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as that creature is enchanted.
flavor_text: In the harsh depths of Rootwater, the charms of surface dwellers are quite useless . . . except as lures.

rulings.text: Can target an unenchanted creature but has no effect on that creature.
A creature is “enchanted” if it has any Auras attached to it.
Unlike many similar creatures, Rootwater Matriarch untaps as normal during your untap step. Whether it’s tapped or untapped has no bearing on the control-change effect.

The control effect applies so long as at least one Aura is attached to the creature, and will continue to apply even if Rootwater Matriarch has left the battlefield. The effect ends if at any time the creature has no Auras on it.

name: Sage Owl
oracle_text: Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

name: Scalpelexis
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Scalpelexis deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top four cards of their library. If two or more of those cards have the same name, repeat this process.

rulings.text: The “repeat this process” means to repeat as often as it takes to not get a matching pair.

name: Sea Monster
oracle_text: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
flavor_text: It's easy to believe the monster is a myth—until you feel three hundred thousand pounds of myth crashing down on your ship.

name: Shimmering Wings
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{U}: Return Shimmering Wings to its owner's hand.
flavor_text:
"I leave words like ‘impossible' to the rabble. Whatever I imagine, I can create."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

name: Sift
oracle_text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.
flavor_text: Dwell longest on the thoughts that shine brightest.

name: Sky Weaver
oracle_text: {2}: Target white or black creature gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor_text: "Let my wisdom give you wings."

name: Snapping Drake
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text: The irritable drakes are solitary nesters. Even brooding females barely contain the urge to attack their own young.

name: Spiketail Hatchling
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Sacrifice Spiketail Hatchling: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
flavor_text: It dodges waves of water to prepare for waves of magic.

rulings.text: The spell’s controller gets the option to pay when this ability resolves.

name: Sunken Hope
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player returns a creature they control to its owner's hand.
flavor_text:
"I don't concern myself with my enemy's hopes. Hopes follow the tides. They will retreat soon enough."
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Telepathy
oracle_text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
flavor_text:
"The question isn't whether I can read minds. It's whether I have yet to find a mind worth reading."
—Ambassador Laquatus

name: Telling Time
oracle_text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of those cards into your hand, one on top of your library, and one on the bottom of your library.
flavor_text: Mastery is achieved when "telling time" becomes "telling time what to do."

rulings.text: If there are fewer than three cards in your library, follow the instructions in the order given for any cards that are there.

name: Thieving Magpie
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
flavor_text: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies collect jewels for theirs.

name: Tidings
oracle_text: Draw four cards.
flavor_text:
"Though the letter was many pages long, I could tell all I needed to know from one look at the messenger's face."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Time Stop
oracle_text: End the turn. (Exile all spells and abilities on the stack, including this card. The player whose turn it is discards down to their maximum hand size. Damage wears off, and "this turn" and "until end of turn" effects end.)

rulings.text: Exiling a spell or ability prevents that spell or ability from resolving, but it doesn’t technically “counter” anything. This means that Time Stop can exile spells and abilities that “can’t be countered.”

Unless Time Stop is cast during the Ending phase, any “at the beginning of the end step”-triggered abilities don’t get the chance to trigger on the turn Time Stop is cast. These abilities will trigger at the beginning of the next end step.

Ending the turn this way means the following things happen in order: 1) All spells and abilities on the stack are exiled. This includes Time Stop, though it will continue to resolve. It also includes spells and abilities that can’t be countered. 2) All attacking and blocking creatures are removed from combat. 3) State-based actions are checked. No player gets priority, and no triggered abilities are put onto the stack. 4) The current phase and/or step ends. The game skips straight to the cleanup step. The cleanup step happens in its entirety.

If any triggered abilities do trigger during this process, they’re put onto the stack during the cleanup step. If this happens, players will have a chance to cast spells and activate abilities, then there will be another cleanup step before the turn finally ends.

name: Time Stretch
oracle_text: Target player takes two extra turns after this one.
flavor_text: There's lots of time like the present.

rulings.text: If multiple “extra turn” effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

name: Traumatize
oracle_text: Target player puts the top half of their library, rounded down, into their graveyard.
flavor_text:
"The educated mind is heavy with lore and knowledge. It's also the most likely to collapse under its own weight."
—Ambassador Laquatus

rulings.text: The player can put the cards in their graveyard in any order they choose.

name: Twincast
oracle_text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
flavor_text: Imitation is the most dangerous form of flattery.

rulings.text: You can’t choose to pay any additional costs for the copy. However, effects based on any additional costs paid for the targeted spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy too.
Twincast copies any text spliced onto the targeted spell, but you can’t splice additional text onto the copy.
Twincast can target (and copy) any instant or sorcery spell, not just one with targets. It doesn’t matter who controls it.

As Twincast resolves, it creates a copy of a spell. That copy is created on the stack, so it’s not “cast.” Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won’t trigger. The copy will then resolve like a normal spell, after players get a chance to cast spells and activate abilities.

The copy will have the same targets as the spell it’s copying unless you choose new ones. You may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, you can’t choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal).
If the spell Twincast copies is modal (that is, it says “Choose one —” or the like), the copy will have the same mode. You can’t choose a different one.
If the spell Twincast copies has an X whose value was determined as it was cast (like Earthquake does), the copy has the same value of X.

If the copy says that it affects “you,” it affects the controller of the copy, not the controller of the original spell. Similarly, if the copy says that it affects an “opponent,” it affects an opponent of the copy’s controller, not an opponent of the original spell’s controller.

name: Twitch
oracle_text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card.
flavor_text: Battles are won in nuance.

rulings.text: If the targeted permanent is an illegal target by the time Twitch resolves, the entire spell doesn’t resolve. You don’t draw a card.

name: Unsummon
oracle_text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: Tolarian apprentices learn to liberate Ætheric energy long before they are taught to bind it.

name: Vedalken Mastermind
oracle_text: {U}, {T}: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: The vedalken see other beings from a cold distance, as either experimental subjects or objects of study.

name: Wall of Air
oracle_text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
flavor_text:
When no falcons fly, beware the sky.
—Femeref aphorism

name: Afflict
oracle_text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor_text: One rarely notices a heartbeat, save when it is stolen.

name: Agonizing Memories
oracle_text: Look at target player's hand and choose two cards from it. Put them on top of that player's library in any order.
flavor_text: In the aftermath of war, when the slaying is long done, the greatest miseries come home to roost.

name: Ascendant Evincar
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Other black creatures get +1/+1.
Nonblack creatures get -1/-1.
flavor_text: His soul snared by an angel's curse, Crovax twisted heroism into its purest shadow.

rulings.text: If Ascendant Evincar stops being black, it gives itself -1/-1.

name: Assassinate
oracle_text: Destroy target tapped creature.
flavor_text:
"This is how wars are won—not with armies of soldiers but with a single knife blade, artfully placed."
—Yurin, royal assassin

name: Beacon of Unrest
oracle_text: Put target artifact or creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. Shuffle Beacon of Unrest into its owner's library.
flavor_text: A vertical scream pierces the night air and echoes doom through the clouds.

rulings.text: If a Beacon is countered or doesn’t resolve, it’s put into its owner’s graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

name: Bog Wraith
oracle_text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor_text: Knowing Takenuma Swamp to be dangerous, Hisata set wards to warn him of predators. He never imagined that his murderer would pass through them unhindered.

name: Consume Spirit
oracle_text: Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to any target and you gain X life.
flavor_text:
"Your blood, your marrow, your spirit—all are mine."
—Mayvar, minion of Geth

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number chosen for X, not the amount of damage Consume Spirit deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted permanent or player is an illegal target by the time Consume Spirit would resolve, the entire spell doesn’t resolve. You won’t gain any life.

name: Contaminated Bond
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller loses 3 life.
flavor_text:
"My favorite curses are those that manifest slowly, blackening the soul in ways the victim cannot hope to understand."
—Erissa, bog witch

name: Cruel Edict
oracle_text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature.
flavor_text:
"Choose your next words carefully. They will be your last."
—Phage the Untouchable

name: Deathmark
oracle_text: Destroy target green or white creature.
flavor_text:
"I hope it's true that every snowflake is unique, because I never want to see one like this again. Now clean up that body."
—Thangbrand Gyrdsson, Kjeldoran patrol

name: Diabolic Tutor
oracle_text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
flavor_text: The best ideas often come from the worst minds.

name: Distress
oracle_text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor_text:
"They say the eyes are the windows to the soul. I like to break windows and take what's inside."
—Braids, dementia summoner

rulings.text: If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

name: Doomed Necromancer
oracle_text: {B}, {T}, Sacrifice Doomed Necromancer: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor_text: Many necromancers share the same last words—the ones that conclude the undeath ritual.

name: Dross Crocodile
flavor_text:
"As soon as it surfaced, we could all smell it. Its rancid breath reeked of half-digested carrion and its own rotting innards."
—Dafri, Auriok champion

name: Drudge Skeletons
oracle_text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor_text:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook

name: Dusk Imp
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text: Imps are just intelligent enough to have an understanding of cruelty.

name: Essence Drain
oracle_text: Essence Drain deals 3 damage to any target and you gain 3 life.
flavor_text:
"The elves are right: Death inevitably leads to life. But the truly powerful don't just experience this cycle. They control it."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

rulings.text: If the target permanent or player is an illegal target when Essence Drain tries to resolve, it won’t resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won’t gain 3 life.

name: Fear
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor_text:
"Even the bravest of warriors yet knows the dark clutch of fright upon his stalwart heart."
—Lim-Dûl the Necromancer

name: Festering Goblin
oracle_text: When Festering Goblin dies, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: In life, it was a fetid, disease-ridden thing. In death, not much changed.

name: Grave Pact
oracle_text: Whenever a creature you control dies, each other player sacrifices a creature.
flavor_text:
"The bonds of loyalty can tie one to the grave."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

rulings.text: Each other player sacrifices a creature for each creature you control that goes to a graveyard.

name: Graveborn Muse
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of Zombies you control.
flavor_text:
"Her voice is damnation, unyielding and certain."
—Phage the Untouchable

name: Gravedigger
oracle_text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

rulings.text: A “creature card” is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

name: Hate Weaver
oracle_text: {2}: Target blue or red creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: "Let my hate fuel your fury."

name: Head Games
oracle_text: Target opponent puts the cards from their hand on top of their library. Search that player's library for that many cards. The player puts those cards into their hand, then shuffles their library.

name: Hidden Horror
oracle_text: When Hidden Horror enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.
flavor_text: If the presence of evil were obvious, it wouldn't be nearly as dangerous.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, you choose whether to sacrifice the creature or perform the other action. If you can’t perform the other action, then you must sacrifice the creature.
If the creature is no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, you may still perform the action if you want.

name: Highway Robber
oracle_text: When Highway Robber enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
flavor_text: "Tonight, madam, it's your money and your life."

name: Hypnotic Specter
oracle_text: Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.
flavor_text: Its victims are known by their eyes: shattered vessels leaking broken dreams.

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if the Specter’s damage is being redirected to an opponent. It does not trigger if damage that would have been dealt to the opponent is redirected to a nonopponent player or a creature, or if the damage is prevented.

name: Knight of Dusk
oracle_text: {B}{B}: Destroy target creature blocking Knight of Dusk.
flavor_text: "Challenge me with your strongest. I will paint my sword with their blood."

name: Looming Shade
oracle_text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Its form never rests, propelled by some undetectable gale from beyond the gloom.

name: Lord of the Pit
oracle_text: Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.

rulings.text: If you control any other creatures as Lord of the Pit’s triggered ability resolves, you must sacrifice one. You can’t choose to be dealt 7 damage instead.

If Lord of the Pit has gained lifelink, being dealt 7 damage by it doesn’t cause your life total to change, even though you gain and lose life. If your life total is less than 7, you won’t lose the game.
If you have two Lords of the Pit, you can sacrifice them to each other.

name: Lord of the Undead
oracle_text: Other Zombie creatures get +1/+1.
{1}{B}, {T}: Return target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: "Do not weep at your defeat, my dear. In death, you will serve a greater purpose—mine."

rulings.text: Lord of the Undead now has the Zombie creature type and its first ability has been reworded to affect *other* Zombies. This means that if two Lord of the Undead are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

name: Mass of Ghouls
flavor_text:
"An army has filled the valley, but it's not like any army I've ever seen. There are no tents, no fires, no horses . . . just a sea of bodies, writhing and moaning, as if a pestilent village were sent to invade us."
—Onean scout

name: Megrim
oracle_text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
flavor_text:
"Pain is both a tool and a craft. Like any tool, it must be sharpened. Like any craft, it must be practiced."
—Hooks, Cabal torturer

name: Midnight Ritual
oracle_text: Exile X target creature cards from your graveyard. For each creature card exiled this way, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
flavor_text: Bury old friends deeply, lest they return bearing worms.

name: Mind Rot
oracle_text: Target player discards two cards.
flavor_text:
"The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them."
—Volrath

name: Mortal Combat
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if twenty or more creature cards are in your graveyard, you win the game.
flavor_text: The crowd roared, the fighters bled, and the dead piled high in the pits. Only the Cabal could win.

rulings.text: If you don’t have twenty or more creature cards in your graveyard by the time your upkeep starts, the ability won’t trigger that turn.

Mortal Combat’s ability has an “intervening ‘if’ clause,” so the condition is checked again when the triggered ability resolves. If you don’t still have twenty creature cards in your graveyard, the ability does nothing.

name: Mortivore
oracle_text: Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{B}: Regenerate Mortivore.
flavor_text: The light sigh of its breath whistles through its bones.

name: Nantuko Husk
oracle_text: Sacrifice a creature: Nantuko Husk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
The soul sheds light, and death is its shadow. When the light dims, life and death embrace.
—Nantuko teaching

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Nantuko Husk itself to activate its own ability. However, the only thing that will do is put Nantuko Husk into the graveyard.

name: Nekrataal
oracle_text: First strike
When Nekrataal enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.
flavor_text: His victims don't have time to feel despair.

rulings.text: Nothing happens if there are no nonartifact, nonblack creatures on the battlefield when Nekrataal enters the battlefield, but if there is one, you must target it, even if it’s a creature you control.

name: Nightmare
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
flavor_text: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.

rulings.text: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner’s graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare’s power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.
The ability that defines Nightmare’s power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield.
Nightmare’s ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

name: No Rest for the Wicked
oracle_text: Sacrifice No Rest for the Wicked: Return to your hand all creature cards in your graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.
flavor_text:
"The soul? Here, we have no use for such frivolities."
—Sitrik, birth priest

rulings.text: It doesn’t matter who controlled the creature cards when they were on the battlefield. As long as they were put into your graveyard, you get to put them into your hand.

If you sacrifice No Rest for the Wicked on the same turn you cast it, all creature cards that were put into your graveyard from the battlefield that turn will be returned to your hand, including any that were put into your graveyard before No Rest for the Wicked entered the battlefield.

name: Phage the Untouchable
oracle_text: When Phage the Untouchable enters the battlefield, if you didn't cast it from your hand, you lose the game.
Whenever Phage deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
Whenever Phage deals combat damage to a player, that player loses the game.

rulings.text: It is only considered “cast from your hand” if you cast it as a spell from your hand. Putting it onto the battlefield from your hand using a spell or ability will cause you to lose the game.
In a Commander game where this card is your commander, casting it from the Command zone does not count as casting it from your hand.

name: Phyrexian Rager
oracle_text: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
flavor_text: It takes no prisoners, but it keeps the choicest bits for Phyrexia.

name: Plague Beetle
oracle_text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor_text: No one knows whether they were named for the disease they carry or for the speed at which they multiply.

name: Plague Wind
oracle_text: Destroy all creatures you don't control. They can't be regenerated.

name: Rain of Tears
oracle_text: Destroy target land.
flavor_text:
"When mortals die, they have family, friends, compatriots to mourn them. When the land dies, all else dies with it, and there is no one left to weep."
—Jacinth, Skyshroud ranger

name: Ravenous Rats
oracle_text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
flavor_text: Nothing is sacred to rats. Everything is simply another meal.

name: Recover
oracle_text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Draw a card.
flavor_text: As Barrin exhumed his daughter's body, he finally realized the full price of his faith in Urza.

name: Relentless Rats
oracle_text: Relentless Rats gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield named Relentless Rats.
A deck can have any number of cards named Relentless Rats.

rulings.text: The second ability of Relentless Rats lets you ignore the “four-of” rule. It doesn’t let you ignore format legality. For example, during a Masters 25 Limited event, you can’t add Relentless Rats from your personal collection.

name: Royal Assassin
oracle_text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
flavor_text: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

rulings.text: Can’t target itself because you choose the target before you tap him. At that time he is not yet a legal target.
If the creature is no longer tapped when the Assassin’s ability resolves, then the ability doesn’t resolve.

name: Scathe Zombies
flavor_text:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Sengir Vampire
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
flavor_text: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger. It doesn’t matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

name: Severed Legion
oracle_text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

name: Warp World
oracle_text: Each player shuffles all permanents they own into their library, then reveals that many cards from the top of their library. Each player puts all artifact, creature, and land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield, then does the same for enchantment cards, then puts all cards revealed this way that weren't put onto the battlefield on the bottom of their library.

rulings.text: Anything that triggers during the resolution of this will wait to be put on the stack until everything is put onto the battlefield and resolution is complete. The player whose turn it is will put all of their triggered abilities on the stack in any order, then each other player in turn order will do the same. (The last ability put on the stack will be the first one that resolves.)

Taking it slowly, here's what happens when Warp World resolves:
    1) Each player counts the number of permanents they own.
    2) Each player shuffles those permanents into their library.
    3) Each player reveals cards from the top of their library equal to the number that player counted.
    4) Each player puts all artifact, land, and creature cards revealed this way onto the battlefield. All of these cards enter the battlefield at the same time.
    5) Each player puts all enchantment cards revealed this way onto the battlefield. An Aura put onto the battlefield this way can enchant an artifact, land, or creature that was already put onto the battlefield, but can't enchant an enchantment that's being put onto the battlefield at the same time as it. If multiple players have Auras to put onto the battlefield, the player whose turn it is announces what their Auras will enchant, then each other player in turn order does the same, then all enchantments (both Auras and non-Auras) enter the battlefield at the same time.
    6) Each player puts all of their other revealed cards (instants, sorceries, planeswalkers, and Auras that can't enchant anything) on the bottom of their library in any order.

Tokens are permanents but not cards. They’ll count toward the number of permanents shuffled into your library, so you’ll get a card back for each token you owned. But the tokens themselves should be ignored while you’re revealing *cards* from your library. In practice, you shouldn’t actually shuffle them into your library since they’ll cease to exist as soon as Warp World finishes resolving. Note that a token’s owner is the player under whose control it first entered the battlefield.

If a permanent leaves the battlefield this way but ends up in a zone other than a library (most likely because it’s a player’s commander in the Commander variant), it’s still counted to determine how many cards to reveal.

name: Abundance
oracle_text: If you would draw a card, you may instead choose land or nonland and reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card of the chosen kind. Put that card into your hand and put all other cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: This replacement effect replaces the draw, so nothing that triggers on a draw will trigger.

If you use this on a multi-card draw, each replaced draw is handled separately. In other words, you reveal and then put on the bottom of the library for the first card, then do the same for the second, and so on. In a multi-card draw you do not have to choose how many of those draws will be replaced before you do any drawing or use of this card.
If no card of the chosen type is found before your library empties, you don’t get a card, but you do get to order all the cards in your library any way you choose.

If your library is empty, Abundance can prevent you from losing the game for being unable to draw a card. If an effect or turn-based action would cause you to draw a card, you can replace that draw with Abundance’s replacement effect. (It doesn’t matter that you’d be unable to actually draw a card.) Since Abundance’s effect has you put a card into your hand instead of drawing a card, you’ll never be forced to draw a card with an empty library.

For example, if you pay {3} to make it a 3/3, then someone gives it -1/-1, it will be a 2/2. name: Pithing Needle
oracle_text: As Pithing Needle enters the battlefield, choose a card name.

rulings.text: Pithing Needle affects cards regardless of what zone they’re in. This includes cards in hand, cards in the graveyard, and exiled cards. For example, a player can’t cycle Eternal Dragon or return an Eternal Dragon from their graveyard to hand if Pithing Needle naming Eternal Dragon is on the battlefield.
You can name any card, even if that card doesn’t normally have an activated ability. You can’t name a token unless that token has the same name as a card.
If you name a card that has both a mana ability and another activated ability, the mana ability can be activated but the other ability can’t be activated.
Once Pithing Needle has left the battlefield, activated abilities of sources with the chosen name can be activated again.
Activated abilities include a colon and are written in the form “[cost]: [effect].” Triggered abilities and static abilities of the named card work normally.

name: Platinum Angel
oracle_text: Flying
You can't lose the game and your opponents can't win the game.
flavor_text: In its heart lies the secret of immortality.

rulings.text: Effects that say the game is a draw, such as the _Legends_(TM) card Divine Intervention, are not affected by Platinum Angel. They’ll still work.

You can concede a game while Platinum Angel on the battlefield. A concession causes you to leave the game, which then causes you to lose the game (Once you concede, you no longer control a Platinum Angel, so its ability can’t prevent you from losing the game).

No game effect can cause you to lose the game or cause any opponent to win the game while you control Platinum Angel. It doesn’t matter whether you have 0 or less life, you’re forced to draw a card while your library is empty, you have ten or more poison counters, you’re dealt combat damage by Phage the Untouchable, your opponent has Mortal Combat with twenty or more creature cards in their graveyard, or so on. You keep playing.

Other circumstances can still cause you to lose the game, however. You will lose a game if you concede, if you’re penalized with a Game Loss or a Match Loss during a sanctioned tournament due to a DCI rules infraction, or if your _Magic Online_(R) game clock runs out of time.
If you control Platinum Angel in a Two-Headed Giant game, your team can’t lose the game and the opposing team can’t win the game.

name: Sculpting Steel
oracle_text: You may have Sculpting Steel enter the battlefield as a copy of any artifact on the battlefield.
flavor_text: An artificer once dropped one in a vault full of coins. She has yet to find it.

rulings.text: Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied artifact will trigger when Sculpting Steel enters the battlefield. Any “as enters the battlefield” or “enters the battlefield with” abilities of the chosen artifact will also work. For example, if Sculpting Steel copies an artifact creature with sunburst, the copy will get +1/+1 counters based on the number of different colors of mana used to pay Sculpting Steel’s total cost. If Sculpting Steel copies a noncreature artifact with sunburst, the copy will get charge counters based on the number of different colors of mana used to pay Sculpting Steel’s total cost.

Sculpting Steel doesn’t copy whether the original artifact is tapped or untapped. It also doesn’t copy any counters on that artifact, any Auras or Equipment attached to that artifact, or any effects that are currently affecting that artifact — you get exactly what’s printed on the chosen card and nothing more. So if you copy an animated Chimeric Staff, for example, you get a normal, nonanimated Chimeric Staff.

If the chosen artifact is copying something else (for example, if the chosen artifact is another Sculpting Steel), then your Sculpting Steel enters the battlefield as whatever the chosen artifact copied.

If the chosen artifact is a token, your Sculpting Steel copies the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that put it onto the battlefield. Your Sculpting Steel is not considered to be a token.
You can choose not to copy anything. In that case, Sculpting Steel stays on the battlefield as an artifact that doesn’t do much of anything.

name: Spellbook
oracle_text: You have no maximum hand size.
flavor_text:
"Everything the wise woman learned she wrote in a book, and when the pages were black with ink, she took white ink and began again."
—Karn, silver golem

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Spellbook onto the battlefield, you’ll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

"Once you create perfection, what else is there to make?"

rulings.text: You can put creatures onto the battlefield by means other than casting them.
Yes, this only affects you.
A “creature spell” is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.
